sub_title: Principal Scientist in Data & AI in Healthcare at Philips/Team Lead/Professor in 'Risk Modelling and Communication in Healthcare'
summary:
Steffen Pauws, 

I am a distinguished Principal Scientist in Data & AI, an inspirational Team Lead, a proud Professor in 'Risk Modelling and Communication in Healthcare', and a seasoned grant writer and coordinator. 

I act as a driving and pioneering force in Research & Innovation for Philips - Outpatient and Home - Healthcare business and markets.  With a team sized 10-15 Data & AI experts, I create AI models and algorithms for sleep, respiratory care, diabetes care and cardiology in outpatient or home healthcare settings. My own work has led to business transfers (20+) and propositions in the market. 

I work with clinical partners from renowned hospitals and clinics in the US, UK, Japan, India, Singapore, and the Netherlands. 

I have authored more than 100 scientific publications and hold close to 25 patents and more than 40 patent applications on Music Technology and Healthtech. I coordinated and/or co-wrote 15 EU and 9 national submitted grant proposals. 

I hold an Endowed Professorship with a Special Appointment on ‘Risk Modelling and Risk Communication in Healthcare'.  Since November 2014, I have a Honorary Fellow position at Leiden University Medical Center for data science consultancy in Neonatal Intensive Care.

Prior to joining Philips Research, I worked as PhD candidate, post-doc and Researcher in Language, Speech Music Technology at the Institute for Perception Research (IPO) of the Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e). I hold a PhD from the Technical University of Eindhoven, since 2000, in Music Recommender Technology, a PDEng degree on Software Technology, and a Master of Science in Medical Informatics from Leiden University.

Expertise on: | Healthcare Data Science | Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare | Health Risk Modelling | People management | Grant Writing and Coordination |
